In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a function in Julia that wraps a string by iterating over words and adding a new line each time the maximum text width would be exceeded:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, ' ')
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        if !isempty(current_line)
            current_line *= " "
        end
        current_line *= word
    end

    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Here's an example of how to use the function:

```julia
text = "This is a long string that needs to be wrapped."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

Output:

```
This is a
long string
that needs
to be
wrapped.
```
